title: Hello, Columbus: Reader-submitted vacation photos
text: Request to buy this photo From left, Barry and Connie Thomson and Jim and Sue Wanken of Mount Vernon examine the gap between the American and Eurasian tectonic plates at Thingvellir National Park, Iceland. The travelers report that umbrellas are useless in gale-force winds, so take a hooded, waterproof jacket. Request to buy this photo From left, Caroline, Abigail and Tim Fraker of Westerville explore the Cliffs of Moher on the west coast of Ireland. Donâ€™t be afraid to rent a car and drive on the left side of the road, the family advises, but be sure to take a GPS device to explore the back roads. Brad and Erin Wisard of Columbus visit Grand Teton National Park near Jackson, Wyo. The travelers report that rangers at the visitors centers can help you choose hiking trails to fit your ability.
